title: Kensa Undercover Brella
content:
The Kensa Undercover Brella is a main weapon in Splatoon 2. It is a Toni Kensa-branded variant of the Undercover Brella.

The Kensa Undercover Brella shares its overall design with the Undercover Brella. However, the Kensa Undercover Brella has a black handle and a white shield. The Toni Kensa signature red clothespin is attached to the muzzle.

- Unfolded

- Folded

The Kensa Undercover Brella was released on 7 November 2018 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It comes with Torpedoes and Ink Armor.

- The Kensa Undercover Brella is a lightweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 118. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The Kensa Undercover Brella's canopy has 200 HP.
Brella canopies have different incoming damage multipliers for each weapon type.

- Brella canopies have different incoming damage multipliers for each weapon type.

- The canopy takes 0.17 seconds to open.

- The canopy does 15 damage to opponents on contact.

- The canopy cannot be launched.

- If the canopy is destroyed, it takes 4.5 seconds to return.
After splatting an opponent or assisting a teammate in splatting an opponent, the canopy will reappear if it had been destroyed, or be restored to maximum durability if it was still functional.

- After splatting an opponent or assisting a teammate in splatting an opponent, the canopy will reappear if it had been destroyed, or be restored to maximum durability if it was still functional.

- Each shot consumes 4% of the ink tank's capacity, allowing the player to fire 25 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- Brella canopies have different incoming damage multipliers for each weapon type.

- After splatting an opponent or assisting a teammate in splatting an opponent, the canopy will reappear if it had been destroyed, or be restored to maximum durability if it was still functional.

- After firing, there is a 0.67 second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
The cooldown after holding the canopy open is 0.5 seconds.

- The cooldown after holding the canopy open is 0.5 seconds.

- When initially firing the weapon in humanoid form, the shot takes 8 frames to come out.
When firing from swim form, the shot takes 15 frames to come out.

- When firing from swim form, the shot takes 15 frames to come out.

- When firing continuously, it fires a round of pellets every 26 frames.

- The interval between firing and when the player is able to enter swim form or use a sub weapon is 20 frames.

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.72 units per frame.

- The Kensa Undercover Brella fires 7 projectiles per shot. Each projectile can do between 9 and 12 damage. A maximum of 4 projectiles per shot will damage the opponent, but the maximum possible damage per shot is capped at 40.

- If a projectile is in the air for more than 8 frames after being fired, it loses 0.1875 damage per frame until it reaches 9 damage at frame 24.

- Shots can deviate 4 degrees horizontally and 2.7 degrees vertically.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 20 units per frame for 4 frames. Shots travel straight for 80 distance units.
After that, the projectile's velocity is set to 19.085 units if the projectile's velocity is not already lower than the listed value, and decreases further as it falls to the ground.

- ▲ Increased the effect of the Main Power Up gear ability.

- ▲ The reduction in time it takes for a Brella's umbrella portion to be restored with the maximum number of Main Power Up gear abilities equipped has been raised from roughly 33% to roughly 44%.

- ▲ The effect provided by Main Power Up is now more easily triggered, even with fewer instances of the gear ability equipped.

- ▲ The effect of Main Power Up will be more noticeable even at lower stack levels.

The Kensa Undercover Brella is a limited edition, custom umbrella created in collaboration with the Toni Kensa brand! Use the Torpedo sub to distract your enemies, then rush in and take 'em out while they're distracted! The special is Ink Armor, which gives you extra protection if your Brella gets busted. It'll give you one more chance to turn the tables! This set's mix of offense and defense let's[sic] you keep the enemies guessing, perfect for more technical players!
